title: Check out the 3D models of the Samsung Galaxy S25 series
description: The Samsung Galaxy S25 series, unveiled a few days ago, includes four phones - Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, Galaxy S25 Ultra, and Galaxy S25 Edge. The Edge will get a proper launch later, but the other three phones are already up for pre-orders in key markets. And, if you don't want to walk into the nearest store for a proper look at one of these three phones, we've got you covered with the 3D models of the trio. We partnered with Binkies 3D a few years ago to add 3D models to our specs pages of popular phones so that you can check the designs of these handsets in a better way compared to the...
excerpt: These 3D models help you get a better idea of the phones' designs when checking them in-person is not possible. The Samsung Galaxy S25 series, unveiled a...
text: The Samsung Galaxy S25 series, unveiled a few days ago, includes four phones - Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, Galaxy S25 Ultra, and Galaxy S25 Edge. The Edge will get a proper launch later, but the other three phones are already up for pre-orders in key markets. And, if you don't want to walk into the nearest store for a proper look at one of these three phones, we've got you covered with the 3D models of the trio. We partnered with Binkies 3D a few years ago to add 3D models to our specs pages of popular phones so that you can check the designs of these handsets in a better way compared to the brands' official websites without having to visit the physical stores or when trying them in-person is not possible, and, the 3D models of the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra are now up on our website. Samsung Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 UltraYou can find the 3D models by clicking on "Pictures" on a phone's specs page and scrolling down. These work with mobile and desktop web browsers and even our app, which is currently only available for Android and can be downloaded from here. Samsung Galaxy S25 If you haven't explored the 3D models on our website before, here's how it works: On smartphones or touch-enabled devices, you can use your fingers to rotate the handset to view it from different angles and use the pinch-zoom gesture for a closer look. On desktop computers, you can use the mouse and its scroll wheel. Samsung Galaxy S25+ These widgets have a Full-Screen button on their bottom-right to provide a better experience to the viewers. You can also click on the color names written below the models to see the phones in different shades. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Now that you know how it works, you can check out the 3D models of the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra we've embedded below. Samsung Galaxy S25 Samsung Galaxy S25+ Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra You can read our Samsung Galaxy S25 series coverage wrap-up here for more details about the S25 lineup.
html:
The Samsung Galaxy S25 series, unveiled a few days ago, includes four phones - Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, Galaxy S25 Ultra, and Galaxy S25 Edge. The Edge will get a proper launch later, but the other three phones are already up for pre-orders in key markets. And, if you don't want to walk into the nearest store for a proper look at one of these three phones, we've got you covered with the 3D models of the trio.

We partnered with Binkies 3D a few years ago to add 3D models to our specs pages of popular phones so that you can check the designs of these handsets in a better way compared to the brands' official websites without having to visit the physical stores or when trying them in-person is not possible, and, the 3D models of the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra are now up on our website.

Samsung Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra

You can find the 3D models by clicking on "Pictures" on a phone's specs page and scrolling down. These work with mobile and desktop web browsers and even our app, which is currently only available for Android and can be downloaded from here.

Samsung Galaxy S25

If you haven't explored the 3D models on our website before, here's how it works: On smartphones or touch-enabled devices, you can use your fingers to rotate the handset to view it from different angles and use the pinch-zoom gesture for a closer look. On desktop computers, you can use the mouse and its scroll wheel.

Samsung Galaxy S25+

These widgets have a Full-Screen button on their bottom-right to provide a better experience to the viewers. You can also click on the color names written below the models to see the phones in different shades.

Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra

Now that you know how it works, you can check out the 3D models of the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra we've embedded below.

Samsung Galaxy S25

Samsung Galaxy S25+

Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra

You can read our Samsung Galaxy S25 series coverage wrap-up here for more details about the S25 lineup.
